abstract.text: An interface for providing an app-specific capability that people invoke
from system experiences like Siri and the Shortcuts app.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: To expose your app’s functionality to system experiences like Siri or the
Shortcuts app, and to support interactivity in widgets, you need to implement
the
protocol. Use it to provide phrases that can trigger
the functionality, describe the needed data for the functionality you make available,
and implement the method that performs the functionality.
The system instantiates an app intent you create parameter-less using the
initializer whenever a person invokes it through a system service
like Siri, Shortcuts, and so on. If available, the system sets parameters
based on user input or other available sources. With set parameters, the
system attempts to resolve them in the order of their declaration in the
body. After it resolves all parameters, the system calls
to perform the app intent with its
configured parameters. Note that the system retains the app intent and
its output only for the duration of the invocation.
Session 10032:
Declare a custom intent type by defining a structure that conforms to the
protocol:

code: static var description = IntentDescription("Orders a soup from your favorite restaurant.")

inlineContent.text: Then, declare the AppIntent’s parameters. When you implement an
type, parameters must be declared with the
property wrapper.

abstract.text: Make your app’s content and actions discoverable with system experiences like Spotlight, widgets, and enhanced action capabilities of Siri, powered by Apple Intelligence.
Use App Intents to register actions for your app.

doc://com.apple.AppIntents/documentation.title: Responding to the Action button on Apple Watch Ultra

abstract.text: Enable people to configure app intents with their custom input values.

doc://com.apple.AppIntents/documentation.title: Adding parameters to an app intent

abstract.text: An interface for providing an app-specific capability that people invoke
from system experiences like Siri and the Shortcuts app.
The type of parameter summary representing this intent.
A property that defines the authentication policy that indicates
whether this app intent requires the device to be unlocked or otherwise
authenticated.
A description of the app intent that the system shows to people.
Donates the intent to the transcript.
Donates the intent to the transcript.
Donates the intent and optional result to the transcript.
Donates the intent and optional result to the transcript.
Creates an app intent.
A boolean value that determines whether system features such as Shortcuts
and Spotlight can discover this app intent.
A boolean property that tells the system to consider the app intent even
if its app is not in the foreground.
Defines the summary of this intent in relation to how its parameters are populated.
Performs the intent after resolving the provided parameters.
Requests user confirmation before performing the app intent.
Requests user confirmation before performing the app intent.
Request user confirmation before performing the app intent.
Requests user confirmation before performing the app intent.
Context information that’s available while the system performs the app intent’s action.
A short, localized, human-readable string that describes the app intent
using a verb and a noun in title case.
An app intent that Siri performs to fulfill a person’s request.
An App Intent that plays, pauses, or otherwise modifies audio playback state when it executes.
An app intent that starts, stops or otherwise modifies audio recording state.
An App Intent that plays, pauses, or otherwise modifies audio playback state when it executes.
Designates intent that will launch an activity that uses device’s camera to capture photos or videos.
Marking your intent with this protocol makes it available as a possible action for Camera quick action.
An interface for configuring a Control Center module.
Create your first app intent that makes your app available in system experiences like Spotlight or the Shortcuts app.
An interface for replacing a custom SiriKit intent that allows existing
shortcuts and donations to continue working.
Delete the associated entity(s).
An app intent that marks an action as deprecated and informs people which action to use instead.
A protocol you use for app intents which begin their work with the app in the background but
may request to continue in the foreground.
Create app intents, entities, and enumerations that conform to assistant schemas to tap into the enhanced action capabilities of Siri and Apple Intelligence.

doc://com.apple.AppIntents/documentation.title: Integrating actions with Siri and Apple Intelligence

abstract.text: An enumeration that describes the authentication policy to use when running an app intent.
A type that contains the result of performing an action, and includes optional information to deliver back to the initiator.
An intent that starts, pauses, or otherwise modifies a Live Activity when it runs.
An intent that starts, pauses, or otherwise modifies a Live Activity.
Adopt App Intents to make your app discoverable with Siri and Apple Intelligence, Spotlight, controls, widgets, and the Action button.

doc://com.apple.AppIntents/documentation.title: Making actions and content discoverable and widely available

abstract.text: Open the associated item.
An intent that opens a universal link.
A result builder that allows you to declaratively describe a parameter summary.
An App Intent that lets someone pause your app’s current workout session.
Defines a string that uniquely identifies a type. This is useful for maintaining the identity
of a type, even when its type name is changed.
An intent that looks for videos based on a search term, then plays the content.
An interface that allows the system to suggest the app intent to someone in the future using predictions you provide.
An intent that reports progress to the system during its execution
An intent that begins or ends an audio transmission with the Push to Talk framework.
An App Intent that lets someone resume your app’s paused workout session.
An interface for providing an app intent that you use to adapt your app’s behavior when Focus changes.
An intent that contains a value which can be set.
An app intent that takes a person to search results for a specified search term.
An App Intent that lets people start a dive session when they press the Action
button on Apple Watch Ultra.
An App Intent for starting a workout.
Designates intent types provided by App Intents.
An app intent with a URL representation.
An interface for configuring a WidgetKit widget.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
